collections.title: Avatar Collections
collections.description: This site hosts multiple avatar collections with different licenses and sources:

original.title: Our Original Avatars (CC0)
original.name: 100Avatars Series (R1, R2, R3) - 300 free avatars
original.license: License: CC0 (Public Domain) - use however you want, no attribution needed
original.batchDownload: Batch Download: ArDrive Folder - Open Source Avatars by ToxSam
original.includes: Includes: VRM files, alternate formats (FBX, voxel versions), textures, renders

vipe.name: VIPE Heroes Genesis
vipe.description: Genesis PFP collection of VIPE NFT Avatar Marketplace. With interoperability, IP Commercial Rights and Customization.

toxsam.name: ToxSam
toxsam.description: Collection of NFT avatars by ToxSam across Ethereum and Base networks

halloween.name: Halloween Rising
halloween.description: Spooky Halloween avatars - 60 VRM Avatars on the Optimism blockchain with 5 designs, 3 styles and 5 variations. Released on the deprecated VIPE platform

xmas.name: Xmas Chibis
xmas.description: VIPE's Christmas Avatar Collection 2023. 80 VRM avatars with 16 designs and 5 variations on Polygon.

collections.licenseNote: License matters! CC0 avatars can be used freely without credit. CC-BY avatars require attribution to the original creator. Always check the collection details.

database.title: Avatar Database (GitHub)
database.description: Access all avatar metadata as JSON files - perfect for integrating into your app or game.

website.title: Website Source Code
website.description: The gallery website itself is also open source.

vrm.title: About VRM Format
vrm.description: VRM is a 3D avatar file format designed for games, VR, and virtual worlds.

why.title: Why we use VRM:
reasons: Works across multiple platforms (Unity, web browsers, VR apps)
Open standard - not locked to one company
Includes built-in rigging for easy animation

ardrive.title: What is ArDrive?
ardrive.description: ArDrive is permanent, decentralized storage built on Arweave.

why.title: Why it matters:
reasons: Files stored forever (can't be deleted or taken offline)
Perfect for preserving open source content

ardrive.note: Our original avatars (100Avatars series) are stored on ArDrive to ensure they're always available, no matter what happens to this website.

philosophy.title: Open Source Philosophy
philosophy.description: We believe avatars should be free and accessible.
philosophy.why: That's why our original collections are CC0 (public domain):
philosophy.note: Community collections have their own licenses - we make these easy to find so you know exactly what you can do with each avatar.
philosophy.conclusion: The metaverse should be built on open standards, not locked behind paywalls.

help.title: Need Help?
help.questions: Questions about licenses? Check the collection details on each avatar page.
help.building: Building something? Our JSON data is free to use - build your own avatar browser!
help.contribute: Want to contribute? Submit your collection via GitHub Discussions.
